entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 2 - Stormborn (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 2 - Stormborn (2)20170902
I get moist eyed a lot while watching this show... when people
talk all brave and selfless.

Littlefinger is constantly being beaten up by Starks. His whole
life.

It is interesting to see how it would have been better for Dany
to have taken Olenna's advice more quickly.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 3 - The Queen's Justice (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 3 - The Queen's Justice (2)20170902
I love their faces when the dragons fly by.

Cersei is so brutal.

It is very interesting watching it a second time. For instance,
Littlefinger perks up when Wolken says that there's an archive of
every raven scroll.

"The Climate" :)

I love all the remixes of the Rains of Castamere.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 4 - The Spoils of War (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 4 - The Spoils of War (2)20170902
Jon never does see Bran or Arya this season, although he does
find out they are alive.

It is very cute when Jon and Dany are together.

Arya's fight scene was so awesome.

The ending sequence was so amazing. I loved the feeling of being
there you got when Bronne was running around frantically.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 5 - Eastwatch (2)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 5 - Eastwatch (2)20170902
It's amazing to imagine people turning to ash before your eyes.

Cersei's words makes me think she doesn't need the wight to be
convinced. But they wouldn't get Jaime that way.

I like Jon always goes to the front. He's like Ned, he doesn't
expect others to do things for him.

Dany's look when Jon leaves is great.

I hope Sam got something useful from his library raid.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 6 - Beyond the Wall (3)
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 6 - Beyond the Wall (3)20170902
It is so funny when the Hound tells off Gendry.

It is cool to hear ravens in the background when Sansa &
Littlefinger are talking.

The wight is tied up, which means that it either broke out while
in the box or they deliberately untied to make a bigger
impression when they let it out. I like the second idea!

entry.title: Book: Bitterblue, by Kristin Cashore (2012) (2)
entry.content:
Book: Bitterblue, by Kristin Cashore (2012) (2)20170901
I finished it today. It was really quite disturbing... a whole book
about a whole nation recovering from being rape victims. Pretty
grim. I would have liked to have some more about what Leck was
trying to do... I imagine him trying to create and understand
Gracelings. The introduction of Fire at the end was a little bit
too easily wrapped up without enough punch to it.
  • Books
  • 2012

entry.title: Book: Bitterblue, by Kristin Cashore (2012)
entry.content:
Book: Bitterblue, by Kristin Cashore (2012)20170829
I started this today and am enjoying it a lot. I like how these
books are all quite different, but also have a very consistent
feel, like they really are in the same world. This is especially
striking in this one because Katsa appears and seems foreign and
familiar.
  • Books
  • 2012

entry.title: Movie: Wonder Woman, starring Gal Gadot (2017)
entry.content:
Movie: Wonder Woman, starring Gal Gadot (2017)20170829
This was a totally awesome movie, I loved it. She's so cool and
does so many tough things. I really enjoyed all the fights she was
in and how things built up so well. It was great. It was really
cute how out-of-place she was. It felt a lot like the first Captain
America, but better in so many ways.
  • Movies
  • 2017

entry.title: Book: Fire, by Kristin Cashore (2009) (2)
entry.content:
Book: Fire, by Kristin Cashore (2009) (2)20170828
I finished it today. What an interesting ending. I like that it
sets up a connection between the worlds. Her fight against Leck was
pretty intense. I suspect that when Fire meets the Graceling Realm,
it will not go well!
  • Books
  • 2009

entry.title: Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 7 - The Dragon and the Wolf
entry.content:
Game of Thrones - Season 7 - Episode 7 - The Dragon and the Wolf20170827
It is cool how influential Ned still is after all this time. He
motivates so many of the characters and actions.

I was very nervous about Qyburn taking the wight hand.

Bran: I'm the three eyed raven.
Sam: Ooooooh... I don't know what that means.

I really thought Cersei was going to kill Jaime.  I am very
curious about how they will receive Jaime in the North: Jaime to
Bran, "I'm sorry I pushed you out the window." Bran, "You looked
great when Locke cut off your hand."

Speaking of Bran, he did help against Littlefinger's
"prosecution", but he really has not been that useful so far.

I really liked how proud the Hound seemed of Arya.

I am nervous that Tyrion offered Cersei something, but then again
it could also just be that it was part of Cersei's plan to trick
Dany.

The Night King on dragonback was intense. Yikes.

---

Predictions: Season 8 won't end with a lot of time spent
post-trauma in the glorious rule of Dany... half an episode at
most, but probably much less. I also think that it would be bad
to have something like three dedicated to the Night King and
three dedicated to Cersei afterwards, so my suspicion is that
both threats will be dealt with at the same time. How could that
happen? Maybe Jaime goes North, talks to the crew, and then The
Hound and Arya go south to kill Cersei, but get into hyjinks
along the way. I think the big questions are...
- How many dragons are left at the end? I assume that Dany & Jon
have an airborne dragon fight with the Night King and two of
them (the dragons) kill each other.
- Will Jon and Dany marry? How will they react to The News? I
think the worst thing would be for them to decide to get
married in Episode 1 and then learn the news in Episode 2 and
then Jon doesn't want to marry because of honors but Dany
doesn't care, so they have some conflict over that.
- Who ends up ruling Westeros? I assume that the Targaryens win,
but there's a conflict between Jon and Dany over this. Jon
definitely won't care about being heir and doesn't want to be
king. Dany will be pissed about it, but not at Jon, instead
she'll be pissed about how it makes people question her and use
it as ammunition against her reign. In the end, it won't matter
because Jon will die in the battle for the living. On the other
hand, maybe Dany dies in child-birth?
- Will Bran do anything useful or awesome with his powers? I
highly doubt it, but it would be cool if he did. I like the "he
is the Night King" theory, but I don't think it will be true.

I like the idea the Cersei knew Tyrion knows she won't help,
because she calls Jaime the stupidest Lannister.

I like the idea that Tyrion is worried about Jon and Dany because
their child might not be a good king.
  • TV Shows
  • Game of Thrones
